channel.title: Toys - Digg
channel.description: Toys on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: How Does One Actually Go About Becoming a LEGO Master?
item.description: "LEGO Masters" finalists Boone and Mark explain how they built their legacies.

item.title: Inside The World Of Hot Wheels Rally Car Racing
item.description: It might not be nearly as big as Formula One, but it's every bit as dramatic and fun.

item.title: Six Expert Tips For Making Money Off Your Beanie Baby Collection
item.description: Before listing your Beanie Babies on eBay, it helps to know if they're actually valuable. An antiques appraiser shared her tips for making the most money from your collection.

item.title: This Lego Machine Gun That Shoots Playing Cards Is Seriously Cool
item.description: Finally, a use for that deck of playing cards sitting in your desk drawer.

item.title: Baby Yoda's Official Life-Size Figure Is Here, And It's Fabulously Expensive
item.description: Baby Yoda, aka "The Child" from Disney Plus' The Mandalorian, at last has an official, life-size (16.5 inches), super-detailed figurine … but at a price of $350, it'll cost you an arm and a leg.

item.title: Guy Builds A Drone Made Almost Entirely Out Of Lego Parts And It Actually Flies
item.description: The only parts that are not made of Lego are the battery, radio receiver and flight controller.
item.kicker: BUILD IT UP BRICK BY BRICK

item.title: The Odd Origin Story Of The Ball Pit
item.description: It's a childhood staple for millions around the world — and we might have a jar of onions to thank.

item.title: This Real-Life Transformer Might Be One Of The Coolest Robot Toys Ever Made
item.description: The unofficial Transformer toy transforms from car to robot all by itself. You can literally say "Transform," one of several voice commands, and the Robosen T9 will do so.

item.title: The Story Of The 'Baby Benz,' The World's Most Coveted Toy
item.description: How exactly did these toys come to dominate the turn of the century, and how did one manufacturer - Power Wheels - sell over a million toy cars in 1990 alone?

item.title: Guy Spends Two Days Restoring An Abandoned Lamborghini Model Car And The Result Is Glorious
item.description: What is old and rusty may never die.

item.title: Brokering Bricks: The Lucrative World Of Lego Investing
item.description: Consider the following: In 2000, you, enterprising investor, might have bought some index funds from the S&P 500 and ended up doubling your money by today. By contrast, if you invested in several collector's edition LEGO Imperial Star Destroyers for $270, you would have quintupled your money.

item.title: The Accidental Invention Of Play-Doh
item.description: The much-loved children's toy was a desperate spinoff of a putty used to clean soot off of wallpaper.

item.title: The Strange, Sad Story Of The Ken Doll's Crotch
item.description: Like a perverted and plastic riff on the old chicken-or-egg cliche, Ken's crotch was a key feature of his own conception.

item.title: Why Are Plastic Army Men Still From World War II?
item.description: Surely they should have drones and iPhones by now.

item.title: Is 2-Versus-1 Fair With An Extra Large Ping Pong Table?
item.description: If the table is four times the size of regulation, does having an extra person and paddle still present an advantage?

item.title: It's Not That Weird To Be An Adult Who Loves Hyper-Realistic Baby Dolls
item.description: Hyper-realistic baby dolls, known commonly as "reborn dolls," or simply "reborns," are many things: collectors' items, scene partners for popular YouTube videos, or vehicles for therapy. But perhaps above all, they're art, and the people who make them can sell their work for hundreds or thousands of dollars.

item.title: How Aggressively Cute Toys For Adults Became A $686 Million Business
item.description: 8,000-plus characters, 29 Conan O'Brien dolls alone: inside the Funko Pop Vinyl phenomenon.

item.title: Watch The Final Game Of The 2019 Scrabble Championship
item.description: We're not going to mince words: Carl Johnson and Alec Sjoholm are both excellent at "Scrabble" and watching them play is a true pleasure.

item.title: Drone Operator Does Some Incredible Maneuvering To Chase Behind A Remote Control Car Race
item.description: You know a drone operator is particularly skilled when we are more focused on his piloting than on the race he is chasing.

item.title: This Glowing Dog Hand Puppet Is Nothing Short Of Spectacular
item.description: Puppet maker Barnaby Dixon is back at it again with a weird and whimsical creation.
item.kicker: GETTING ALL OF THE MANNERISMS TO A TEE

item.title: Cornhole (yes, cornhole) is going pro
item.description: Born in Europe — or maybe China — this simple game took hold in the American Midwest. Now, it's aiming for the Olympics.

item.title: It Probably Took Took A Lot Of Time And Lego To Perfectly Recreate Kawhi Leonard's Amazing, Bouncing Game-Winner
item.description: This stop-motion animation of one of the most pivotal moments of the Champion Toronto Raptors' season has us in awe.

item.title: Taiwan Is in the Clutches of a Claw Machine Craze
item.description: In arcades across the land, at all hours of the day, people vie for both novel and practical prizes.

item.title: Way Dog Do Way Better At Jenga Than Your Clumsy Ass Ever Could
item.description: Not only is Secret an extremely cute Australian shepherd, she also has better fine motor control than most preteens.

item.title: How Mattel Shrinks Cars Into Hot Wheels (Crash Test Included)
item.description: Before a Hot Wheels car hits a store shelf, it must pass the "launcher on speed 2" test and the "side slam launcher" test, among others.

item.title: Listen To This Xylophone Made Out Of Hot Wheels Play A Charming Ditty
item.description: A perfect little internet video for your viewing and listening pleasure.

item.title: This Zip Line Can Whip Around Corners
item.description: Like a personal rollercoaster for one, this newly invented zip line is bizarrely the product of safety testing.

item.title: Why Solving A Rubik's Cube In Under Three Seconds Is Damn Near Impossible
item.description: A Rubik's cube novice interviews world record-setting speedcubers and the creator of the Rubik's cube himself to learn the limitations of the hobby.
item.kicker: OUR FINGERS ARE SORE JUST WATCHING THIS

item.title: Puzzle Expert Tries To Solve An 'Impossible' Bolt Release Puzzle
item.description: What's even more interesting than him actually solving it is him sketching out what's happening inside without even seeing it.

item.title: Horror Movies Love A Haunted Doll. So Do Collectors
item.description: Etsy and eBay list thousands of dolls purportedly inhabited by everything from evil witches to judgmental spirits that might call you fat to young children and fairy spirits.

item.title: Electric RC Car Speeds Its Way To 122MPH
item.description: This blue bullet thinks its a full-sized gasoline-powered car, flying across an empty stretch of highway.

item.title: The Scariest Toy A Child Could Play With
item.description: The Atomic Energy Lab kit — the world's most dangerous toy — contains not one, not two, but three different sources of radiation.

item.title: Have Your Brain's Language Centers Blown Apart By The 2018 Scrabble Championship
item.description: Nigel Richards and Joel Sherman have much better vocabularies than you or I or anyone else you've probably ever met.

item.title: How A Professional Yo-Yoer Racks Up World Championships
item.description: Listening to Gentry Stein talk about his passion for yo-yos is might make your head spin. But watching him do the thing is oddly blissful.

item.title: Arcade Basketball Wizard Absolutely Demolishes NBA Halftime Competition
item.description: Cleveland Cavaliers, please start this guy at shooting guard.

item.title: How YouTube Is Changing Toys
item.description: Kids are obsessed with YouTube unboxing videos. The toy industry is taking notice.

item.title: This Curious Gizmo Plays Music Beamed At It From A Flashlight
item.description: Perhaps we're ignorant buffoons, but we had no idea that light waves could carry music and we're a bit in awe.

item.title: A Totally Hypnotic, Amazingly Intricate Marble Machine
item.description: Following marbles as they bounce around this contraption is its own unique form of meditation.

item.title: What's The Maximum Number Of Hula Hoops A Human Can Spin At Once?
item.description: The record is currently set at 200, but how much farther could it theoretically go up?

item.title: Guy Makes A Functional Rubik's Cube Out Of A Pork Pie And Then Eats It
item.description: Human ingenuity knows no bounds.

item.title: Guy Spends Two Years Building A 126,000-Piece K'Nex Ball Track, And It's Incredible
item.description: "Over 126,000 pieces, 10 lifts, 14 motors, and over 1000 feet of track. It features a 40 foot long self-supporting bridge, a 6 foot tall vertical loop, a 100 foot long illuminated path, and a 6.5 foot wide spiral bowl." No wonder it took two years.

item.title: Lego's Big Fictional Brand Is An Oil Company. Why?
item.description: There's always gotta be a brand.

item.title: The 2019 Marble Race Qualifying Round Is Just Stupidly Satisfying
item.description: It's been an open secret on the internet for a while now, but watching marbles do their thing is oh-so mesmerizing.

item.title: The World's Fastest First-Person-View RC Quadcopter Clocks In At A Cool 265 MPH
item.description: To pilot customized crafts like this one, pilots must don video goggles that give them a first-person view of the flight for safety purposes.

item.title: Meet The Furby Collectors Of Tumblr
item.description: Inside the thriving — but threatened — Tumblr community dedicated to collecting and customizing vintage robot toys.
item.kicker: OH YES, AND LONG FURBY COLLECTORS TOO

item.title: This Life-Size Terminator T-800 Might Be The Coolest Thing We've Seen Made Out Of Legos
item.description: Constructing this took 15,000 Legos and some metal bars to support the Terminator's full weight.

item.title: Watch These Vertical Domino Masterpieces Come Tumbling Down, Down, Down
item.description: We're projecting all of our negative emotions about 2018 onto these innocent 'nos.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Plays With 2018's Most Dangerous Toys
item.description: If you're on the nice list, you get nice presents. If you're on the naughty list, you get coal. If you're in between, you get one of these.

item.title: The Cast Of The Marvel Cinematic Universe Played The Luckiest Game Of Boggle Ever
item.description: As it turns out, Don Cheadle is really, really good at Boggle.

item.title: Kids' Toys Are The Latest Battleground In The Online Privacy Wars
item.description: A consumer report sheds light on security risks associated with kids' toys, including a popular Amazon tablet.
